description: Now that Japan has reopened its borders, it is time for real sakura and delicious treats. Read more at straitstimes.com.
title: Japan opens up at last: Places to feast at
title_page: Japan opens up at last: Places to feast at | The Straits Times
maintext:
TOKYO â€“ Singaporeans subscribe to Japanese snack boxes, haunt Japanese food fairs in supermarkets, pose for photos with pretend sakura (thank you for standing in, pink poui), and pay way too much money for Japanese meals.
Now, though, the country has opened its borders and nothing stands between us and the land of, well, the real sakura.
